definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: Right mindfulness is a shield that protects us from our enemies.
sentences.chinese: 正念如盾牌，可以抵禦強敵，何衛自身。

sentences.english: Fear is a person’s greatest enemy.
Die at the hands of powerful enemies are heroes, dare not Take That are a coward.
sentences.chinese: 死在對強敵的手裏是英雄，不敢接招是懦夫。

sentences.english: She ducked before the strong opponent.
I knew you were strong, he was a powerful enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你很強大，而他是個強敵。

sentences.english: Complex intrigues where the hero must thwart the subtle machinations of seemingly unbeatable opponents.
sentences.chinese: 勇者必須破解近乎無懈可擊的強敵所編織的詭詐陰謀。

sentences.english: I knew you were strong, but Arronax is a powerful enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你很強大，而阿羅納克斯是個強敵。

sentences.english: This move makes them an instant title contender in the West.
sentences.chinese: 這一舉動將使得他們成爲西部冠軍的強敵。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
